main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects over Caribou, Maine on various dates in 1952 and 1956.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright lights moving rapidly in the sky, with one witness estimating its speed at 400-500 knots, larger than an aircraft, and disappearing suddenly.
Air Force pilots observed a bright light approximately 40-50 feet in diameter, moving steadily before accelerating and disappearing at an extremely high rate of speed, leaving no vapor trail.
A T-6 pilot reported a bright light that remained stationary before accelerating to an extremely high speed, and the control tower also observed an unidentified flying object moving rapidly.
The Senior Control Tower Operator at Presque Isle AFB in 1956 described an unidentified light in the sky as ascending rapidly with colors varying from purple, blue, to green.
Northwest Airlines flight 12 was observed during the sighting, and the unidentified light was confirmed to be separate and unconnected to the aircraft.
witnesses: T-33 pilots, T-6 pilot, Senior Control Tower Operator, 18th Tow Target Squadron
